name: 4x120
format:
Preliminary Round: MCQ Test (30 minutes)

Each team is required to solve 30 questions of 1 mark each.

The top ten teams from the Preliminary round will qualify for the finals.


Final Round: Coding (2 hours)

Each team is assigned with two problems to be solved within the given time duration. Each team can select any one language for coding (C/C++/Python). All four members of the team are allowed to code only in the chosen language.

The two problems A and B will be of equal difficulty.

Only one member of the team is allowed to code a question at a time. Two members of the team can work on the two questions simultaneously for a duration of 15 minutes, while the other two sit idle. At the 15-minute mark, the members have to swap positions with the remaining two. The members of the team have to keep rotating in this manner every 15 minutes throughout the duration of the contest.

The winner is decided on the basis of the points received for solving the questions. In case of a tie, the time of execution will be taken into consideration.

There will be three types of questions - A, B and C where: A - easiest with low weightage B- moderate C - difficult with high weightage. If the participant chooses to skip a question that was selected, he or she can only pick a more difficult question.
rules:
• College ID cards are mandatory. Any other forms of identification shall not be entertained.
  • Use of mobile phones or any other electronic device is not permitted during the event.
  • All participants should be undergraduate students.
  • A team shall comprise of exactly 4 members. Cross college teams are allowed.
  • In the event of a tie, a tie-breaker will be the deciding factor.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point of time and participants will be duly notified in such an event.
about:
Form a squad of 4 and code your way to victory in 120 minutes. Keep in mind, each team member will get only 15 minutes to work on a question. The turn is passed on to the remaining members when the clock strikes the 15-minute mark.

Communication and coordination within the squad are vital for survival. Ensure your team operates in the same wavelength, or rather, code out the same solution!

name: Algorithms
format:
Preliminary Round

All the questions are multiple choice questions (MCQ).

There will be 30 minutes to solve 30 questions with one mark for each right answer.

Only 15 participants will qualify to the final round.


Final Round

The participants have to face five programming problems of different difficulty levels .

The test will end in 3 hours.

The winner is determined by the score in the final round
rules:
• Participants should compete individually.
  • Participants should reach the venue on time.
  • Least complex programs will be given preference.
  • Malpractices of any form shall not be entertained.
  • Use of mobile phones during the event, is strictly prohibited.
  • The programming languages allowed are: C, C++. Java and Python
  • Decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Event rules may be subjected to change and participants will be duly notified.
about:
Revisit your fundamental skills in computer science and solve the most complex and perplexing problems with maximum efficiency! Algorithms tests your coding skills with data structures and your programming logic. Participants are required to understand the basic concepts of programming in depth. They would also be evaluated on their expertise in high-level programming languages.

Tackle the challenges head on and don't shy away from experimenting with your code to make it even better. Equip yourselves to debug any errors and write the perfect code to win!

name: Debugger
format:
The event shall have 2 rounds:

Round 1: Prelims

This shall be an MCQ round of 30 minutes duration. The participants are requested to form a team of maximum two members.

Top ten teams shall qualify for the finals.

Round 2: Finals

5 different types of problems shall be given and the contestants have to debug each of it within a time period of 3 hours. The team with the maximum points will be declared as the winners. All the programs will be in C++, Java and Python.
rules:
• Participants are requested to reach the venue on time.
  • Participants must have a valid ID card as well as the excel id.
  • Participants are requested to form a team of maximum two members.
  • Any kind of malpractice will lead to disqualification.
  • The decisions of the judges will be final and binding.
about:
If you think you have the eye to find and fix bugs in a program, then Debugger is the perfect challenge for you.

Bring along a teammate to find and resolve potential errors and defects from the given source code within the given time limit. The winning team will be decided based on the points scored on each problem.

Be quick, be sharp and earn the title of the lord of debugging. So, get ready to bring out your debugging skills and dexterity in coding!

name: Reverse Coding
format:
Prelims

  • Each team can have 1-2 members.
  • There will be a total of 30 MCQ questions each carrying 1 mark.
  • Time allocated to finish answering the test is 30 minutes.
  • Top 15 teams qualify for the finals.


Finals

It’s time to dig out the coder in you!

The participants will be given 10 C++ executable files (.o) which is open for them to try and execute. As and when you execute the program a clue statement pops up at the start and asks for an input. The participant can now enter strings or numbers as input and can analyse the output. The participants are free to execute the program as many times as they want. You are expected to understand the logic by looking at the input output pattern and code a program that could generate an output file that works just like the previous one that was given to you. The total time allotted is 3 hours
rules:
• Participants are requested to reach the venue on time.
  • Participants must have a valid ID card as well as the excel id.
  • Any kind of malpractice will lead to disqualification.
  • The decisions of the judges will be final and binding.
about:
Put your creativity and logic to the biggest test! From a given program, your task is to reproduce its code.

In reverse coding, after you’ve made your way through the challenging written preliminary round, prove your mettle by figuring out input-output patterns and deduce the source code of a given executable file. So if you know how the gears of a code turn and can understand the hows, whats and whys of an output, then reverse coding is your place to be.

name: Creative Event
format:
• The participants will be given a topic (brand/product/cause) on which they will have to design a logo and a well-designed website / app for the same.
  • They can use any build system of their choice.
  • Using boilerplate UI is not allowed.
  • They will be judged on the basis of originality, graphics, UI and build system knowledge.
rules:
• Participants are to bring their own laptops, chargers and any other peripherals.
  • Participants are requested to form a team of maximum four members.
  • Plagiarism will result in disqualification.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time and the participants will be notified of the same.
about: Creative Event is a team competition that tests your skill in creative tools like Adobe Photoshop/ Illustrator and the latest web development technology. The teams will be asked to develop a website and create a brand identity on the topic given to them. So if you think you have what it takes to create a brand that would stand the test of time and a website that can make waves, then Creative Event is where you need to be!

name: Life Line
format:
Lifeline is a team event with each team consisting of 2-4 members. The event has 3 rounds and 2 intermediate rounds

Round 1: Preliminary Round (MCQ Test)

The test will be held through Google Forms. The participants will be allowed to answer using their mobile phones or else, laptops will be provided. Your Excel ID and one of the team member's email ID would be used for verification.

Round 2 intermediate: Treasure Hunt

The participants will be sent on a treasure hunt to uncover the question card for the next round.

Round 2: Wave Simulation

The participants will have to draw the circuit diagram and simulate a particular output waveform using simulation software within the given time frame. The question will be found on the question card. The marks would be divided equally between the circuit diagram and the simulation.

Round 3 intermediate: Marketing

The participants will have to market a biomedical product by studying its features based on the technical papers given to the team. Marketing can be technical or a fun-based skit covering all its important features. Marks will be solely based on how much the team could understand the product by reading through its manual.

Round 3: Powerpoint Presentation

In this final round, the participants will be given a real-life problem that they have to solve and then conduct a powerpoint presentation.

IMPORTANT POINTS:

  • Round intermediates carry minimal marks only.
  • There will be no elimination at round intermediates.
rules:
• This will be a team event with each team having not more than 4 members.
  • Intercollege teams are allowed.
  • All members are required to exhibit their college ID and Excel ID cards.
  • All items required for the event will be provided by the coordinators.
  • The decision of the coordinators will be final.
  • Excel team will not bear responsibility for any loss of property, injury or delay caused by participants during the event.
  • Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Participants are not to damage any of the college property or equipment and if found so are liable to be fined.
  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
  • Teams violating the above rules will be suspended immediately.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point of time and will be explained at the event as well.
about:
Lifeline is a biomedical based team event, testing your knowledge with an eclectic mix of both technical and non-technical rounds. Lifeline 2019 is all about solving problems: whether it be through wave simulation, or presentations, or treasure hunt, or marketing. Through a diverse set of competitions, starting with a preliminary MCQ test, the participants’ will be under scrutiny.

So if you have what it takes to take the biomedical world by storm, solving questions everyone else brushes off, then go get your squad, pronto. Because Lifeline is where you need to be.

name: Defuse
format:
The event spans over 5 rounds, including the preliminary rounds. Complete each task within the stipulated time to qualify for the following round.

Round Zero: Written Test

This will test your basic knowledge of digital electronics.

Round 1: Puzzle Solving

You will receive a file containing information collected so far regarding the case. The file is filled with clues. Solve this puzzle to crack a location. Round 2: Debugging

The next location is just a circuit away! Debug a circuit and obtain the right output to find the location.

Round 3: Designing

Design a counter using given components to generate a sequence which will lead to the next location. Remember, a wrong sequence can even detonate the bomb!

Round 4: Defusing

At last, you have reached the bomb! Be weary. In a race against time, Debug the circuit and defuse the ticking time bomb.
rules:
• This will be a team event with each team having not more than 3 members.
  • Inter college teams are allowed.
  • All members are expected to exhibit their college ID and Excel ID cards.
  • Use of internet is strictly prohibited.
  • All items required for the event will be provided by the coordinators.
  • Decision of the coordinators will be final.
  • Excel team will not bear responsibility for any loss of property, injury or delay caused by participants during the event.
  • Teams violating the above rules will be suspended immediately.
  • Malpractices and sabotaging other team’s machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Participants are not to damage any of the college property or equipment, if found so are liable to be fined.
  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
  • Rules are subjected to change at any point of time and it will be explained at the event as well.
about: Tick-Tock, Tick-Tock.Time is running out. Will you be the one to solve the puzzle and defuse the bomb before it gets triggered? As a secret agent, your task is to defuse various bombs, where each one consists of an array of digital circuits. Put your mental and technical ability to the ultimate test as you persist through four demanding rounds of solving puzzles and defusing explosives. So sharpen your minds and prove that your knowledge goes beyond the books!

name: Extrincisity
format:
Preliminary Round

This written preliminary round is based on analog electronics, digital electronics, circuit design and some basic math and aptitude questions. Out of this, the top ten teams will be chosen.

Round 1

The first round starts off with a simple circuit design problem, where the contestants will have to apply the basics of analog electronics. The top six teams will advance to the second round.

Round 2

In this round, the contestants will have to design and implement a circuit to receive a signal that is encoded. They must then decode the information. The top 4 teams to obtain the output will advance to finals.

Round 3 - Finals

The final round will be a debugging session. Firstly, the contestants will have to identify the given complicated circuit network. They will then have to make the necessary changes in order to achieve the full functionality of the circuit. The team which identifies the circuitry and performs successful debugging will be declared as winners.
rules:
• This will be a team event with each team having not more than 3 members.
  • Inter college teams are allowed.
  • All members are expected to exhibit their college ID and Excel ID cards.
  • Use of internet is strictly prohibited.
  • All items required for the event will be provided by the coordinators.
  • Decision of the coordinators will be final.
  • Excel team will not bear responsibility for any loss of property, injury or delay caused by participants during the event.
  • Teams violating the above rules will be suspended immediately.
  • Malpractices and sabotaging other team’s machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Participants are not to damage any of the college property or equipment, if found so are liable to be fined.
  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
  • Rules are subjected to change at any point of time and it will be explained at the event as well.
about:
Get ready to be tested and to learn the field of analog electronics! This fast paced electrical quest will require you to apply your knowledge in critical and time-limited situations.

The competition is a teamwise event which comprises of 4 members. After a qualifying written round that examines your basic knowledge of electronic circuits, the succeeding rounds include the challenges of designing circuits for desired outputs, a signal decoding round, and a final circuit identifying and debugging session.

name: Reverso
format:
Reverso is a team event and each team must consist of 3 or 4 members. The event is spread over 3 rounds.

Round 1:

Preliminary MCQ Test ( Topics such as Arduino Programming, Reverse Engineering & Technology of Home Appliances will be included.)

Round 2:

Phase 1: Each team will be assigned with a home appliance. They are required to study the functionalities of the appliance and make a complete description of the appliance.

Phase 2: A working model of a daily-use appliance constructed in Arduino will be given to a team. Participants are required to debug this model.

Round 3: Each team will be given a circuit designed for a particular use. The team has to model, design and implement a new product from the components of the circuit.

The teams will be awarded points based on their performance in each round. The winner will be decided on the basis of cumulative points.
rules:
• All participants must be school students from classes 10-12. First and second year undergraduate students are also allowed to participate.
  • Participants should have an idea about the basics of Arduino Programming.
  • Any component required will be provided at the venue. Participants need not bring any extra component with them.
  • All members of a team need not be from the same institution.
  • All members are expected to carry their School/College ID Cards and Excel ID Cards with them.
  • Excel team will not bear responsibility for any loss of property, injury or delay caused by participants during the event.
  • Use of mobile phones is strictly prohibited.
  • Teams violating the above rules will be suspended immediately.
  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.


Rules are subject to change at any point in time. The final decision will be made by the organisers.
about:
Reverso, as the name suggests, focuses on the principles of Reverse Engineering. Pulling apart a product down to its basic components, to understand and duplicate the product or enhance its features is called reverse engineering. Participants will be required to debug a circuit and build another working circuit from its parts.

Are you confident about your knowledge of electronic components? Does debugging a circuit excite you? Do you wish to reuse components and create something new? Then Reverso is tailor-made for you! Get ready to delve into the exciting world of Arduino boards, coding and hardware assembly.

name: Lumiere
format:
Round 1: Prelims

The participants will have to answer a set of questions based on electrical engineering concepts. Top 8 teams will advance to the next round.

Round 2: The Big Picture

The shortlisted teams will be given a set of pictures/clues using which they have to deduce the answer related to the pictures. Top 5 teams will advance to the next round.

Round 3: Design

The shortlisted teams will have to design an electrical wiring diagram from the given problem. The first 3 teams to design the circuit will advance to the next round.

Round 4: Wiring

The teams will have to wire the circuit designed by them in the previous round. The team that wires the correct circuit first will be declared the winner.
rules:
• It is a Team event with 3 members per team.
  • Cross college teams are allowed.
  • All participants must have an EXCEL ID. Separate registration is not required for this event.
  • The event comprises of 4 rounds.
  • Excel team reserves the right to take final decisions in case of any dispute.
  • Contestants should present their college ID cards.
  • Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' circuits will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Judges' decision will be final.
  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
about: Think you have the wires in you to connect your way to success? Well then, you’re at the right place where your circuit wiring skills will be put to the test. Design the most efficient circuit in the least amount of time in order to attain the sparkling victory you have always been yearning for. Tick-Tock! Don't let the time run out.

name: MEC Labs
format:
Registration

The registration will start from 1st July and end on 20th July. Registrations are open to all but the participation from second year Btech students is expected. However shortlisting will be done for third year students if participation limit exceeds.

The event consists of 4 phases as described below:

Phase 1: Orientation

This phase aims to enlighten the participants on how to go about projects and discuss the emergence of various technologies with them. The orientation will be held on 20th July. Taking into account the interest of participants’ numerous workshops on the useful technologies for implementing projects will be organised.

Phase 2: Ideation

Here we move on to the most important part of the event. The teams will have to submit a brief abstract of the project idea. This phase begins on 20th July and will end on 10th August . after this comes ideation analysis, where mentoring and suggestions will be given to the participants . this will commence on 10th August and will end on the 17th August .

Phase 3: Gear up session

Now it is time for action! Under the valuable guidance of mentors and teachers participants can complete their projects during the time period alloted for the same. This phase will mostly be held during the weekends of september.

Phase 4: Presentation on the day of Excel

Projects that have been completed can be updated and the ones yet to be completed can be done with the assistance of mentors.The projects should be presented on the first day of Excel with the detailed report of the project.The projects will be judged on the basis of the various criteria and the winners wiall be announced.
rules:
• Participants are not permitted to use modules while designing the project.
  • Participants must attend the orientation.
  • You can participate in teams comprising not more than 4 members.
  • Members from different colleges are also not allowed to fall in one team.
about:
MECLABS is where you think out of the box, build better hardware, create faster software, and find the most innovative solutions to unanswered problems.

Gather a team of four, build your very own project and display it for the world to see. Mentors are available anytime help is needed. Brainstorm and come up with the best of ideas you can lay your hands on and start experimenting, ideating and innovating. Creativity is the key to success.

name: Wave Cloning
format:
There shall be four rounds to the event.

The basic structure of each round will be similar, the contestants will be shown a pattern in CRO, which they have to recreate on their CROs

Round 1

In the first rounds, the teams will have to design a circuit to create a simple pattern using basic devices like diodes,resistors etc. The wave will be shown in the CRO. Last team to design the circuit and last 2 teams to display the waveform on the CRO will be eliminated here.

Round 2

In the 2nd round, the waveform to be produced will be more complicated, and it will be divided into two stages, the first being partial output stage and the second, final output stage.

In the first stage, the participants have to obtain the partial output within the given time limit and the last team to obtain it, will be eliminated. Last 2 teams to obtain final output will also be eliminated.

4 teams will advance to finals.

Round 3

The final round will involve complicated circuits involving more ICs and circuits like comparators,multivibrators etc. First, the teams shall be shown the covered circuit and its output waveform for 120 seconds. Contestants will be given a fixed time to recreate what they saw. The first team that recreates the waveform with perfection will be declared winners.
rules:
• The organizers reserve all rights to disqualify any team for using unfair means at any stage of the event.
  • In case of any discrepancies, the decision of the coordinators is considered final and binding for all the teams.
  • Additional rules will be provided by the organizers onsite.
  • Any violation of the rules provided by the organizers will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The judges’ decision is final.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time.
  • Participants will be duly notified of any changes.
about:
If you can proudly claim to be a mastermind in analog circuit design, get ready to challenge your knowledge in Electronics to the core and discover the amazing patterns formed by beams of Electrons within a CRO!

Form a team of 4 and prepare to display your prowess in the art of circuit design!

After a written preliminary round, your time-bound mission is to design circuits to replicate the given waveforms in their CROs - using only basic electronic elements. As you proceed higher up through rounds, so does the complexity of the required circuit - expect ICs, comparator circuits, and more!

name: C.E.O
format:
Before the game begins, participants are shown the materials available.They can discuss among their team members and decide the materials they will need to build a product.A team will consist of four people.

Round 1

The teams have to build a product from the materials they collect.

Part 1

Two out of 4 members will be blindfolded and the remaining two are not allowed to speak during the collection. (7 minutes)

Part 2

The teams have to create their products and name it. (25 minutes)

The teams will be marked based on their coordination and efficiency.

The top 5 teams qualify to the next round.

Round 2

Part 1

A set of questions testing the managerial and leadership skills of the team along with logic and creative thinking.

Part 2

The participants have to pitch a product given to them, before a panel of judges.

The top 5 participants qualify for the finals.

Round 3

Pressure Round

The finals have been designed to put the contestants under pressure wherein they have to resolve a crisis thrown at them, and present their solution to the audience and the judges.
rules:
• The organizers reserve all rights to disqualify any team for using unfair means at any stage of the event.
  • In case of any discrepancies, the decision of the coordinators is considered final and binding for all the teams.
  • Additional rules will be provided by the organizers during the conduct of the event.
  • Any violation of the rules provided by the organizers will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The judges’ decision is final.
about:
An event designed to bring out the manager within you, C.E.O tests your leadership skills, communication and teamwork through an interesting assortment of tasks.

Form your best team possible, create innovative and interesting products and present it exceptionally, to take home the crown! Remember, in the end, you are as good as your team!

10AM -11.30AM Preliminary Round

12:00PM-1:00PM Intermediate Round

2PM-4PM Final Round

name: Spider Web
format:
This event consists of one preliminary round and four main rounds.

Preliminary round:

This is a 30 minute long written round where your out-of-the-box thinking capabilities and your reasoning skills are examined.

The top 10 teams will move onto the next round. Results will be published within 45 minutes.

First Round

In addition to the current top 10 teams, 2 teams from the audience will now be selected. Out of these 12 teams, 6 teams will commence to the next round.

Second Round

Each team will be given a task to complete. Teams will then compete against each other, and the top 3 teams to finish all the tasks in the shortest time will qualify for the next round.

Third Round

Here, the 3 teams will compete in another set of games and the top 2 teams will qualify for the final round.

FINAL ROUND

The final round consists of two teams which will be split into 8 individual participants, and once again, a race against time. The person who completes all tasks in the shortest time wins.
rules:
• This is a team event of 4 members per team.
  • Inter-college teams are allowed.
  • The contest is open to students from all the colleges.
  • Participants need to produce a valid identity card of their respective institutes.
  • The organizers reserve all rights to disqualify any team for using unfair means at any stage of the event.
  • In case of any discrepancies decision of the coordinators shall be considered final and binding for all the teams.
  • Additional rules will be provided by the organizers on site.
  • Any violation of the rules provided by the organizers will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The judges’ decision will be final.
about:
Spider Web puts your strength, logical thinking and team coordinating capabilities to the ultimate test.

To be played out in teams of four, this event offers you a series of challenges to showcase your endurance as you battle through mud, sweat and ropes - to emerge a winner.

name: Third Eye
format:
• An online Photography competition spanning 4 weeks. Participants can submit their entries based on the theme assigned for the particular time period.
  • Each theme will be published on Mondays at 12 noon. Results of the previous theme (if any) will be noted.

    Theme 1

    Landscape

    Theme 2

    Perspectives

    Theme 3

    Light Painting

    Theme 4

    Golden Hour

  • Participants can submit their entries for all 4 themes.
  • Participants can submit a maximum of 2 photos for each theme.
  • All entries should be mailed to thirdeye@excelmec.org .
  • All entries will be uploaded to the Facebook Page of Excel MEC under the album Third Eye Photography 2019 with the captions provided by the participant and the ID provided by the coordinators. The entries will also be uploaded to the Instagram Page of Excel MEC with the hashtags provided by the participant.
  • 2 winners will be selected for each theme.

    • Judge’s Choice
    • People’s Choice

  • Winning Criteria

    People’s Choice

    Facebook Like - 1Pt

    Facebook Comment - 2 Pt

    Facebook Share - 4 Pt

    Instagram Like - 2 Pt

    Instagram Comment - 3 Pt

    Judge’s Choice

    Alignment with the theme - 40%

    Creativity - 30%

    Photograph quality - 30%

  • Judge – Saahil Rahman
  • The winners will be announced in the Excel MEC Facebook Page.
rules:
• All participants should be undergraduate students studying in India.
  • All entries should be submitted in digital format to the event mail ID.
  • All entries should contain a short description of the photo, the name of the participant, the name of the college/organization/school, phone number and, if possible, the exif details of the photo.
  • All entries should be of the format JPEG or JPG and less than 5MB in size.
  • Photos that portray or otherwise include inappropriate and/or offensive content, including provocative nudity, violence, human rights and/or environmental violation, and/or any other content deemed to be contrary to the law, religious, cultural and moral traditions and practices of India, are strictly prohibited and will be immediately disqualified.
  • Watermarks of any kind are NOT allowed. Submitted pictures will be watermarked from our side to avoid misuse of the submitted picture.
  • Any use of unfair means in the form of plagiarism or show of popularity using unfair mechanisms will be disqualified.
  • Excel 2019 reserves the right to call for original JPEG or RAW files with unchanged EXIF for the purpose of authentication. An image may be disregarded if this information cannot be provided.
  • Submitted photos must be original, created and/or taken by the contestant. It must not contain any materials owned or controlled by a third party for which you have not obtained a license, must not infringe the copyright, trademark, moral rights, rights of privacy/publicity or intellectual property rights of any person or entity.
  • The decision of the Excel 2019 judging panel is final and binding for all participants with respect to all matters relating to the contest.
  • This is a skill-based contest and it plays a part in the determination of winners.
  • By submitting your entry, you acknowledge and agree to the rules and regulations of the contest.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time.
  • All entries retain the copyright to his/her photograph for the duration of copyright to use each photograph and description for advertising, marketing and promotional purposes to any and all media now known or hereafter created.
about:
A picture speaks a thousand words, reveals emotions and captures memories for a lifetime. Do you believe your pictures can weave a story?

Third Eye, a Photography Contest held in the memory of Vineeth Marar is a platform to showcase your pictures and captures. For all the photographers out there, this is the chance to let the world know of the power of your lens!

name: Robosoccer
format:
ROUND 1

Preliminary Round

  • Will be conducted as a knockout match or league match between teams that are randomly selected from the same group.
  • Top two teams from each group will advance to the semi-final. The ranks in the group will be decided by the number of wins.
  • In case of a tie of points in the points table, the goal difference will be taken into account.
  • If a team wins a match it gets 3 points, 1 point if the match ends in a tie and 0 points if it loses.


Duration: 6 minutes match with half time of 30 seconds.

ROUND 2

Semi-final Round

  • Goal post would move along the breadth of the field from this match onwards. The winners qualify to the Finals.
  • Team that scores maximum goals win. In case of a tie, there will be a sudden death.


Duration: 8 minutes match with half time of 1 minute.

Loser's Final

  • Team that scores maximum goals win. In case of a tie, there will be a sudden death.
  • The winners get the third prize.


Duration: 8 minutes match with half time of 1 minute.

ROUND 3

The Grand Finale

  • Team that scores maximum goals win. In case of a tie, there will be a sudden death.
  • The winners get the third prize.


Duration: 10 minutes match with half time of 1 minute.
rules:
• A team can have a maximum of 4 members who need not be of the same college.
  • All participants must have their college ID card/Excel Participation ID.
  • Each team can use only one robot. The coordinators will inspect the robots before the match starts.
  • The controller should stay behind their respective goal post. The robots should be placed at opposite corners before each match starts.
  • In case of unpredictable issues like immobility of the robots or weather, the match may be paused by the judges. They can also decide the position of the robots when the match continues.
  • Coordinators can change the event format anytime during the event.
  • The decision of the judges will be final.
  • Any team/member disrespecting the rules or any other competitors will be disqualified.


Robot Specifications

  • The total dimensions of the robot must not exceed 25cm in length, 25cm in breadth and 20cm in height. 20% tolerance allowed.
  • The weight should not exceed 6kg.
  • It must be manually controlled through wired/wireless interface. Ready-made robots are not allowed.
  • If wired, the length of the wire must be enough to travel the length of the arena without obstructing the football and the opposing robot.
  • Wireless robots will have an advantage of one extra goal in case of a tie.
  • Actuators that help the robot's motion are not allowed.
  • Each robot must have a power supply not exceeding 12V.
  • The trap for the ball must obey the dimensional constraints of the robot with its breadth less than 5cm. The shape should be rectangular with front side open.
  • Use of readymade parts like lego (except remote control kits) is strictly prohibited. if judges suspect that the team has put no effort into the construction of bot and found to be purchased it readymade, the team will be disqualified


Arena Specifications

  • The playing field is of dimensions xcm×ycm.
  • The boundary is marked by a white line lying within the field. Area outside the white line is of 30cm width.
  • An exterior wall of 15cm height is built around the playing field to prevent the ball from escaping.
  • Robots will be blocked by barriers at the corner of the field. The barriers will be removed once the ball is launched.
  • The points will be displayed on the scoreboard.
  • Bots are not allowed to strike the ball using a striker or capture the ball. Only dragging the ball using a projection is allowed. Other bots will be disqualified.
about:
The football fever strikes again! Robosoccer is a football tournament with one manually-controlled robot playing the game for you. Build your robot keeping the arena and robot specifications in mind. Play against teams from the same group and become the best of the lot to reach the next round. Rise up the three rounds to take the prize home.

Foresee yourself in the game and start building a robot that suits it with your teammates. Boot up your bots, stay within the boundary and score the most goals to manoeuvre your bots to victory!

Register Here

name: Instant Photography
format:
• Participants can submit their entries captured during the three days of the fest.
  • The maximum number of entries that can be sent by a participant is three.
  • The best photograph will be selected by the judge on the last day of Excel 2019.
  • Prizes will be distributed on the final day of Excel 2019, along with those of the online competition.
  • Entries must be submitted on the day of the competition at the specified time, without any post-processing
  • 3 winners will be selected based on the quality and creativity of the photographs.
  • Judge – Saahil Rahman
  • The winners will be announced in the Excel MEC Facebook Page.
rules:
• All participants should be undergraduate students studying in India.

  • All entries should be captured on a DSLR or SLR camera.

  • All entries should be submitted in digital format to the event mail ID.

  • All entries should contain a short description of the photo, the name of the participant, the name of the college/organization/school, phone number and, if possible, the exif details of the photo.

  • All entries should be of the format JPEG or JPG and less than 5MB in size.

  • Photos that portray or otherwise include inappropriate and/or offensive content, including provocative nudity, violence, human rights and/or environmental violation, and/or any other content deemed to be contrary to the law, religious, cultural and moral traditions and practices of India, are strictly prohibited and will be immediately disqualified.
  • Watermarks of any kind are NOT allowed. Submitted pictures will be watermarked from our side to avoid misuse of the submitted picture.

  • Any use of unfair means in the form of plagiarism or show of popularity using unfair mechanisms will be disqualified.

  • Excel 2019 reserves the right to call for original JPEG or RAW files with unchanged EXIF for the purpose of authentication. An image may be disregarded if this information cannot be provided.

  • Submitted photos must be original, created and/or taken by the contestant. It must not contain any materials owned or controlled by a third party for which you have not obtained a license, must not infringe the copyright, trademark, moral rights, rights of privacy/publicity or intellectual property rights of any person or entity.

  • The decision of the Excel 2019 judging panel is final and binding for all participants with respect to all matters relating to the contest.

  • This is a skill-based contest and it plays a part in the determination of winners.

  • By submitting your entry, you acknowledge and agree to the rules and regulations of the contest.

  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time.

  • All entries retain the copyright to his/her photograph for the duration of copyright to use each photograph and description for advertising, marketing and promotional purposes to any and all media now known or hereafter created.
about:
Colourful ambience, vibrant and festive atmosphere and a thousand faces that reveal a lot of emotions! Freeze moments with your captures. Excel 2019 is a photographer's dream, the opportunity to let your lens speak for you!

Instant Photography, Excel 2019’s main photo-capturing competition, gives a platform for the photographer in you to shine. With Excel spanning three days, let your creative side run wild and click pictures from a new perspective.

name: XLR8
format:
Team Specifications

  • Each team can have a maximum of 3 members.
  • All members are requested to produce a valid ID card of their institute.
  • Cross college teams are allowed.
  • Participation from school students is also encouraged.


Bot Specification

The maximum dimension allowed for the bot is 20cm X 20cm X 15cm. Also, the bot should be no smaller than 7cm x 6cm x 2cm. The bot may be wireless/wired but its motion must be controlled by the wrist movements of the player. Ready-made microcontroller boards, readymade sensors kits and accelerometers may be used. The bot cannot be made from any readymade assembly kits or Lego parts. Power supply/battery packs for the system will not be provided at the venue.
rules:
• Maximum duration of each round will be given at the venue.

  • The teams are required to complete the track in the minimum possible time.

  • The vehicle should only move through the path specified. If the bot violates the path, external control(tugging on wire, touching the bot etc.) is prohibited. Course corrections must be made in 10 seconds or less.

  • If at any point during the race the vehicle encounters a problem, the participants will be given 2 minutes to go up to the vehicle and fix it.

  • In case of ties, a re-match will be held.

  • The contestants should be ready with the circuit diagrams, algorithms and code (if any) to give proper answers to any questions by the judges.

  • The event managers are reserved the right to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any, will be highlighted on the website and notified to the registered participants.
about:
Here's the competition to discover the best gesture controlled robot!

It is a three round event, the prelims being a basic testing of the robot, the next round being a time trial. The fastest bots to cover the path provided moves onto the finals, where the task at hand is to transport blocks with the bots from one point to the other.

It’s time to XLR8 your way to glory!


Register Here

name: Tech Pursuit
format:
Round 1

This round is a written test comprised of basic electronic, electrical and coding related questions.

Round 2

Provided with a buggy electronic circuit, the teams have to locate the errors and rectify it.

Round 3

The teams will be provided with a C/C++ code with errors. Resolving the error leads to the next clue - your way to a location inside the college.

Final round

Once the members reach the location, their aim is to collect the right set of components to make an electronic circuit. The team that completes the said circuit in the minimum time emerge the winners of the Tech Pursuit.
about:
The hunt for the perfect circuit begins, but can you find the path to the end, past the errors that cloud your way?

A quest to make the best circuit, Tech pursuit is a technical treasure hunt that will test your electronics, electrical and computer coding skills.

After a preliminary written test, you will be faced with buggy electronic circuits and code filled with errors. Your mission is to find the right in the wrong - and rectify them. Following the clues will lead you to the final event, the circuit hunt.

name: Tiki Taka
format:
Tiki Taka is a 3-on-3 football tournament. The matches are played in knockout format. Contestants can register exclusively for this event at the venue, i.e., Excel registration is not required for this event.



Event Rules

  • PLAYERS:

    Only 3 field players are allowed during play and at most 1 sub per team. Players cannot play for multiple teams. Goalkeepers are not allowed. Substitutions may occur for any dead ball situation, but players must get the referee's approval to enter.


  • NO OFFSIDES:

    Side tackling is not permitted.


  • GOAL AREA:

    The goal area, which will be marked, is directly in front of the goal. Defenders cannot touch the ball within the goal area, however any player may move through the goal area. If a defender touches the ball in the goal area, a penalty kick is awarded to the offensive team.


  • GAME DURATION:

    The goal area, which will be marked, is directly in front of the goal. Defenders cannot touch the ball within the goal area, however any player may move through the goal area. If a defender touches the ball in the goal area, a penalty kick is awarded to the offensive team.


  • THREE YARD RULE:

    In all dead ball situations, defending players must stand at least 3 yards away from the ball. If the defensive player's goal area is closer than 3 yards, the ball shall be placed 3 yards from the goal area in line with the place of the penalty.


  • DEAD BALLS:

    All dead ball kicks (kick-ins, free kicks, kick-offs) are indirect with the exception of penalty kicks.


  • KICK OFF:

    May be taken in any direction.

  • PENALTY KICKS:

    Shall be awarded if, in the referee's opinion, a scoring opportunity was nullified by the infraction. Penalty kicks have to be taken from the center of the field and no goalkeeper from the opposing team is allowed.

  • PLAYER EJECTION(YELLOW CARD/RED CARD):

    The referee has the right to eject a player from the game for continual disobedience or as a result of an incident that warrants sending the player out. A yellow card will be issued as a warning and a red card will be issued for a serious offence or when the player receives a second yellow card. The tournament organizers will decide suspension from additional games.
rules:
• Players and spectators are expected to act in the nature of good sportsmanship at all times.


  • Abuse of the referees will not be tolerated.


  • Any instance of misconduct will disqualify the responsible team from the event.


  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions regarding conflicts and other issues.
about:
Block, save, dribble, sprint, shoot, score! Feel the adrenaline rush as you take on the best players in town in an exciting 3vs3 football match.

Bring out the dribbling master in you and don’t forget to pass the ball to your teammates to ensure that your team is the one to emerge victorious in a thrilling and action packed match.

So, Polish up those V’s and nutmegs in order to have a shot at glory.

Registration Fee
  • MEC - Rs. 200
  • Non- MEC - Rs. 400

name: The Khoj
format:
Day 1

Round 1:

A mini treasure hunt around the campus. The top 6 teams that reach the final destination before the rest are selected into the next round.

Round 2:

A treasure hunt in the vicinity (within a 2-km radius). The top 4 teams from this round will be qualified to the next.

Day 2

Round 3:

A treasure hunt conducted around the city of Kochi. The top two teams of this round will qualify to the next.

Round 4:

Both the teams are required to complete a series of tasks to collect a key. The team which collects the key first is declared the winner.
rules:
• Each team must comprise of 4 members only.

  • The participants must carry valid ID Cards at all times.

  • Any malpractice will lead to disqualification of the team.

  • The decision of the organisers will remain final and binding throughout the event.
about:
Excel 2019 presents Treasure Hunt, a union of multiple diverse rounds designed to test the skills of contestants. Be it a quest around the campus or perhaps even around Kochi, make sure you are prepared! Get ready to accomplish different tasks to be declared the winner. Spread over two days, the event is guaranteed to push you to your limits.

So traverse through terrains, cross obstacles and leave no stone unturned in your journey to the treasure. Can your team reach the treasure faster than all others and be crowned the winner? Will your perseverance and determination last through the hunt?

name: De-Cycle
format:
Teams of 4 members each have to create a contraption out of scrap materials to do a given task. There are 3 stages in the event.

Round 1: Battle of Castles

Test: Making a castle using a deck of cards in less than 15 minutes. First 6 teams that manage to make the tallest and most stable castle, qualifies for the next round.

Round 2: Tower of Hanoi

Test: Test of logical skills and reasoning and how fast they can be applied. First 4 teams that complete the Tower of Hanoi qualify for the next round.

Round 3: Final

Test: Developing a product using the scrap household items provided on the spot. The main idea is to recycle the waste products and create something useful so as to set an example for a sustainable future.

The team which makes the most creative and innovative product will be declared the winner.
about:
Do you have a passion for art and a sense of responsibility towards the environment?

Excel’19 presents before you, De-Cycle, where we bring together design skills with a green touch! The event aims to increase artistic skills and at the same time bring a sense of environmental concern in the participants of the event. The team which makes the best creation from the scraps provided will stand out from the rest, and bring home the crown.

name: Effugium
format:
The event shall have 4 rounds

Round 1: PRELIMINARY ROUND

The preliminary round is a written test consisting of 40 questions based on logic and reasoning, with a time duration of 30 minutes. 10 teams are shortlisted from this round.

Round 2: QED ROUND

The round is similar to QED and is AR based. Each team will be provided a mobile and should inspect clues and solve puzzles and finally find the ticket to the escape room.

ROUND 3: ESCAPE ROOM

The finalists are taken to a room and left there. They are given some basic rules and locked inside. The final round consists of 3 rooms and a final lock to get out of. THERE WILL BE A TIME LIMIT OF 45 MINUTES.

Each room will have a set of puzzles and the finalists have to solve them all. The final winners will be decided on the basis of time of completion.
rules:
• This is a team event with Max 4 members per team.
  • Cross–college teams are allowed.
  • The contest is open to students from all colleges.
  • No personal phones allowed.
  • Only after 45 minutes the teams can be let out if they can't complete it.
  • Participants need to produce a valid identity card from their respective institutes.
  • The organizers reserve all rights to disqualify any team for using unfair means at any stage of the event.
  • In case of any discrepancies, the decision of the coordinators is considered final and binding for all the teams.
  • Additional rules will be provided by the organizers onsite.
  • Any violation of the rules provided by the organizers will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The judges’ decision is final.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time.
  • Participants will be duly notified of any changes.
about: If you think you have a soul of an adventurer, then get ready for the escapade of a lifetime as Excel presents to you, Escape Room, a perfect brew of mystery and adventure laced with technology. Fight your way for the ticket to the fabled mystery room and challenge your senses with the help of technology to find your way out and to victory.

name: Game Plan
format:
Round 1: PRELIMINARY ROUND

Prelims include a written test consisting of 25 objective questions. Teams will be shortlisted from this round.

Round 2: INTERMEDIATE ROUND - 1

The 10 shortlisted teams will go up against each other in a quiz. The top 5 teams will advance to the final two rounds. Teams will be awarded points based on their performance.

Round 3: INTERMEDIATE ROUND - 2

The 5 top teams from the quiz round will have to auction for players to form a team in the final round. Teams will be awarded points based on the strength of the team they form.

Round 4: FINAL ROUND

In the final round, the top 3 teams from the last 2 rounds will be pitched against each other in a league format (FIFA 20). Teams will be awarded points as per their performance in the league. The team with the most points accumulated over the last three rounds will be the winners of the event.

Points Weighting

In the decreasing order of points weighting:

  • Round 3: INTERMEDIATE ROUND — 2 (Auction)
  • Round 4: FINAL ROUND (FIFA)
  • Round 2: INTERMEDIATE ROUND —1 (Quiz)


Registration Fee

  • Rs 300/— per team if you are participating solely for this event
  • Rs 200/- per team if you are registering for Excel.
rules:
• This is a team event.
  • Teams can have 2-4 members.
  • Cross-college teams are allowed.
  • The contest is open to all age groups.
  • The organizer reserve all rights to disqualify any team for using unfair means at any stage of the event.
  • In case of any discrepancies, the decision of the coordinators shall be considered final and binding for all teams.
  • Additional rules will be provided by the organizers on site.
  • Any violation of the rules provided by the organizers will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • The judges' decision is final.
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time.
  • Participants will be duly notified of any changes.
about: Think you can handle a football team better than the world’s best coaches? Know the ins and outs of football? Prove yourself digitally by assembling your very own dream team on FIFA through auctions and deliberate negotiations. Pit your team against the others and see who comes out as the winners.

name: Game Zone
format:
Valve’s Counter Strike: Global Offensive - Day 1

Regarded as the ultimate competitive fps shooter, CS:GO lets you pair up with upto four other allies to compete and win, while showing off your precision aim and one taps with style. Clutch the rounds and pump up your adrenaline for this tense single elimination format event. Shoot sharp and go home with upto 15k, and the respect of your adversaries!

KNOCKOUT/SINGLE ELIMINATION

The tournament will be conducted on the first day of Excel [November 8]. The teams will have to pay a small registration fee of 600 per team, which can be split amongst each participant.

Each team gets to ban three maps out of the seven in the roster, and the unbanned map will be played.

The rounds will be single elimination, except the finals which will be a best of three maps.

Standard pro league format rules will be enforced.

MAP POOL: Dust II, Inferno, Mirage, Train, Cache, Overpass, Nuke.



EA Sports Fifa 2020 - Day 2

Think you’re a digital Messi? Prove your worth by competing against the city’s best here at Excel in a tight single elimination format. Show off your skills and expertise and become the best of the best.

Tackle through your opponents and take home the cash price of 8000+. The event will last throughout the day.

KNOCKOUT/SINGLE ELIMINATION

The tournament will be conducted on the second day of Excel [November 9]. Players have to pay a small registration fee of Rs.150 per person.

The rounds will be single elimination with a chance at re-entering once at Rs. 100 per person.

The tournament will be played according to the standard rules and regulations.

Players can select the team of their choice.
rules:
Valve’s Counter Strike: Global Offensive

  • Standard Matchmaking format.

  • LAN Game session.

  • Number of rounds: 15 (Best of One map - voted by both teams)

Maps(7):

  • Dust II

  • Inferno

  • Mirage

  • Train

  • Cache

  • Overpass

  • Nuke



Each team gets to ban three maps from the pool. The one remaining map is played. The starting sides are chosen by a coin toss.

  • The maximum number of team members per team is FIVE - A squad can play with less and will be provided with default bots for unfilled slots.

  • Participants can bring their own peripherals, limited to: headphones, USB keyboards and USB mice.

  • Participants are strictly advised not to bring any sort of configuration files to the event. If any participant is found trying to use their own configuration files without the administrator’s permission during the event, their team will be disqualified without any warning.

  • The event will be controlled by an administrator who monitors the game server. The decision of the admin will be final and binding.

  • Use of glitches as an advantage won’t be entertained.

  • Players are allowed to edit ingame settings and sensitivity. Console commands are allowed.

  • Communication among team members are allowed but cross team communication is strongly discouraged

  • The game mode is Bomb

  • Matches are played based on standard rules.



EA Sports Fifa 2020

  • Match Format: Players go head-to-head in two 4-minute halves.

  • Controller: >b>Playstation Gamepad on the PS4

  • Tournament Format: Knockout.

  • Half length: 4 minutes; 5 minutes in the final rounds.

  • Number of players: 2.

  • Teams: Any international team or club with some experience.


GAME SETTINGS

  • Level: Legendary.

  • Time of day: 08:00 PM.

  • Season: Summer.

  • Weather: Clear.

  • Game Speed: Normal.

  • Team: Club/Nation.

  • Multiplayer Camera: Tele Broadcast.

  • Camera Settings: Default.

  • Time/Score Display: ON.

  • Injuries: OFF.

  • Offsides: ON.



    • TEAM AND CONTROLLER SETTINGS

  • Custom Tactics: Allowed.

  • Custom Formations: Not Allowed.

  • Passing Power Assistance: OFF.

  • Fifa Trainer: OFF

  • Defending: Tactical



    • Note:
    Due to some inconsistencies, the combinations of certain teams may result in the game crashing, in which case either of the players may be asked to change teams.
about:
Consider yourself a pro gamer? Show off your Fifa skills and CSGO one taps here at Excel’s very own gaming competition - Gamezone.

Game Zone Roster:

  • Fifa (PS4) - Rs. 150

  • CS:GO (PC) - Rs. 600 ( Team of 5 )


Game Lounge - Test out the newest games and Virtual Reality sets at the Game Lounge as part of GameZone. It is an exhibition to show off the latest games!

DATE:

Nov 8 (CS:GO, Lounge)
Nov 9 (FIFA, Lounge)

Time: 9:30 to 6

Regsiter Here

name: Lost
format:
All groups will be allowed to participate and complete the maze that is set up. There will be no preliminary written round for the event.

The teams of two will enter the maze and will have to find three spots in a specific order. At each of these spots, the teams will face a technical or non-technical tasks which they have to complete correctly in order to proceed. After completion of tasks in the last spot, the students exit the maze. The team which completes the maze in the least amount of time will be declared the winner.
rules:
• Team consisting of 2 members will be allowed to participate after registration.

  • Mobile phones or any other such communication devices are not allowed.

  • Team exceeding the cut-off time will be disqualified.

  • The decision of the coordinators will be final.
about:
Walls closing in. A puzzle that holds the key. A lone voice to guide you.

Are you ready to find your way?

Played in groups of two, LOST is an event that will test your sense of direction and your sharp problem-solving skills in a test against time. Set up in a maze, your goal is to escape. Head in armed with only your wits, and come out at the other end unfazed.

But beware, with every step completed, more challenges await you – until you reach the very end.

name: Magnum Opus
format:
• From all the submitted entries, 10 films will be shortlisted by the panel
  • The top 10 films will be played on the day of the event in front of the panel of filmmakers who will then decide the winners.
  • Along with the screening, there will be an interactive session, where the filmmakers can interact with the audience and give a description about their film and their journey as a team.
  • Best Film: Cash Price: Rs 6000 + Certificate
  • Second Best Film: Cash Price: Rs 4000 + Certificate
  • Third Best Film: Cash Price: Rs 2000 + Certificate
  • Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Director, Best Story, Best Cinematographer and Best Editor- all of them will win certificates.
  • Online Certificates will be awarded to all the shortlisted entries.
rules:
• Open Event– Entries are invited from all.
  • Entries have to be original, violation of which can lead to direct disqualification.
  • Entry Fee – Rs 200 per team Payment can be made via Paytm or Tez sent along with the DVD.
  • Time Limit - 30 minutes (including title card and credits)
  • Entries can be in any language but suitable subtitles must be provided for languages other than Malayalam.
  • No particular subject/ theme for the competition.
  • All films can be submitted via a YouTube link or a Google Drive link.
  • The entries must be sent along with a filled registration form and a copy of the ID proof of one of the crew members (preferably director, cinematographer or actor).
  • Last Date for sending entries: 31 October 2019.
  • If the film has already been released, a YouTube link of the video should be sent to the coordinators of the event.
about:
Always been in love with the world of movies and short films?

Magnum Opus is the perfect stage for those who have always wished to act and be recognised by well-known filmmakers.

Magnum Opus is a short film contest that will be conducted during Excel 2019. The main purpose of the event is to bring out talented artists who are passionate about cinema and to give them a chance to showcase their work in front of established directors from the industry.

name: Defacto
format:
The event comprises of two rounds: a preliminary round and final round. The preliminary round will be written round and the six best-performing teams are shortlisted into the finals, subject to the condition that a maximum of two teams per school (or four students, alternatively) will make the cut.

The finals will be conducted over multiple rounds, each round having different scoring schemes and rules. Top three teams will be awarded, with an appropriate tie-breaker system in place should there be any such issue.
rules:
• The event is open only to school students.

  • Each team should comprise of two students.

  • Inter-school team combinations are not encouraged.

  • The decisions of the hosts will be final.
about:
How long does it take for you to connect the clues to arrive at the answer?

How quickly can you reach for the buzzer?

DeFacto, the Quiz will challenge your knowledge, speed, and accuracy.

A two round quiz exclusively for school students, Defacto is the perfect place to hone your cognition and win exciting prizes!

name: Foam Football
about:
We won't judge you on how many times you fall…
Excel 2019 brings you an event that will have you falling over yourself, literally.

Foam football is where you play football, but on a foamy, slippery surface with virtually nothing to hold on to. You play not for prizes, money or glory, but for the sake of it (and some bragging rights). So this Excel, come chase a ball that won't stop, on a floor that lets you down to win a few laughs and maybe get some kick out of it.

name: Robowar
format:
Round 1:Preliminary round.

Round 2:Semi-Finals

Round 3:Finals

Round 1: Preliminary round

  • Robots will be divided into two groups. Each robot will have to face every member of its own group and the top four will move to the semi-finals.
  • Points are awarded based on the following fields - speed, skill, controlling ability, and strength.
  • Each bot will have to travel through an inclined surface in order to reach the battlefield. The bot which reaches the centre line first will receive bonus points.
  • If any bot remains tangled in the hurdles for more than the allotted time, the opponent will be rewarded points.

Match Duration - 5 minutes


  • Distribution of bonus points will only be announced one hour prior to the event.

  • Immobilize: Score 10 Points for​ immobilising opponent​ for 10 seconds.

  • Flip the Ring: Score 20 Points​ by flipping opponent robot out of the ring.




Round 2:

The Semi-finals

  • The arena will have undergone some changes.

  • One-on-One Knockout.

  • There will be two semi-finals.

  • The winners of the two semi-finals will qualify to the Grand Finale.


Match Duration - 10 minutes

Point Distribution:

  • Immobilize: Score 10 Points ​for​ ​immobilising opponent for 10 seconds.

  • Flip the Ring: Score 20 Points​ by flipping opponent robot out of the ring.





    • Round 3:​ ​Final

    The Grand finale

    • One-on-one knockout round.

    • 10 minute battle.

    • The bot with the maximum points will win.


    Point distribution:
    • Immobilize: Score 10 Points ​for​ ​immobilising opponent for 10 seconds.

    • Flip the Ring: Score 20 Points by flipping opponent robot out of the ring.
rules:
• Each team can have up to four members.

  • Every participant must have their college ID card/Excel participation ID.

  • Registrations close at 10.00 am on the day of the event.

  • It is not mandatory for all the members of a team to be from the same institution.

  • The robot must be manually controlled through wired/wireless interface.

  • Maximum permitted dimensions of the robot are 45 cm X 45 cm X 45 cm and its weight must not exceed 23 kg. 10% tolerance in weight and dimensions are allowed.

  • Each robot must have its own power supply not exceeding 24V. However a power point(230V AC) will be provided for recharging batteries or to power your supply.

  • Bots can have any form of weapons (other than fire, sharp objects, and projectiles). If any bot is found unsafe for the audience, it'll not be allowed to participate in the event.

  • All teams will should have their bots inspected by the coordinators both before and after each stage.

  • Teams are permitted to make minor changes to the body of their robot after every stage if they wish; but modifying the entire body of the robot will not be permitted.

  • Arena will be disclosed only at the time of the event.

  • Coordinators can make changes to the arena at any point of time.

  • Only two members from each team are allowed to operate the bot during each stage.

  • Both members are allowed to control the bot staying behind the board. So the wire must be of sufficient length in order to cover the entire arena.

  • Any team/team member found disrespecting the rules/other competitors, will be disqualified.

  • Bonus points will be announced one hour prior to the event.

  • Coordinators can change the event format at any time during the event.

  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

  • Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.

  • Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
about:
Bring your robotic champions of power and agility to the ultimate showdown!

In an exciting test of speed and control, it all comes down to the survival of the fittest - based off competitive sport fighting formats, the winner will be chosen after multiple elimination based one-on-one battles. It's time to find out- can your bot stand the test of strength, skill and time?

Register Here

name: Clutch
format: Three's basketball.
rules: Same as three's basketball.
about:
Basketball, the perfect blend of teamwork and raw skill, an intense heart pounding sport that brings together millions of people from around the world.



Clutch is the place for you and your teammates to show your worth. Squad up and compete against some of the best teams from around Kochi and beyond. Work hard, play fair, strive for victory, aim your shots right and net your team the ultimate prize: the respect of your adversaries on top of the glory of victory!

Register Here

name: View Finder
format:
The event requires a team of 5 to shoot videos on a given theme. After completing the shoot , the teams are required to make a film out of the videos shot.



Day 1: The morning session requires teams to assemble at a particular room. The teams are given the theme around which the film has to be made. The teams will have the whole morning to shoot the video, with all actors being on the same team. By afternoon, all the teams have to report back to the room and edit the videos they shot. Mentors will be provided for both the phases, hence they can take help from them.



Day 2: The second day will start with a workshop on visual storytelling and different aspects of filmmaking. The films from the day before will be shown and analysed. At the end of which the results will be announced.
rules:
• Each team must have a maximum of 5 participants.
  • All the actors shown in the film must be of the same team.
  • Participants can shoot the video in any medium(DSLR, mobile phone etc.).
  • All entries should contain a short description of the movie, the name of the participant, the name of the college/organization/school, phone number.
  • Videos that portray or otherwise include inappropriate and/or offensive content, including provocative nudity, violence, human rights and/or environmental violation, and/or any other content deemed to be contrary to the law, religious, cultural and moral traditions and practices of India, are strictly prohibited and will be immediately disqualified.
  • Any use of unfair means in the form of plagiarism or show of popularity using unfair mechanisms will be disqualified.
  • Excel 2019 reserves the right to call for original films for the purpose of authentication. An image may be disregarded if this information cannot be provided.
  • Decisions made by the judges remain final and is not subjected for alteration.
  • This is a skill-based contest and it plays a part in the determination of winners.
  • By submitting your entry, you acknowledge and agree to the rules and regulations of the contest
  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time.
about:
Do you possess a talent to capture the perfect videos of the perfect moments at the right place, and at the right time? Have we got the perfect opportunity for you!
Presenting before you: Videography, a film-making competition, where the participant needs to record videos on a particular theme at any location, edit and make a film out of it.

Registration Fee:

MEC- Free

Non-Mec- Rs. 400

Register Here

name: Excel Play
format: Refer to play.excelmec.org
rules: Refer to play.excelmec.org
about:
Excel Play

Excel Play is an online platform that hosts a variety of technical and non-technical games as a part of Excel 2019.The games hosted on Excel Play are:

Dalal Bull
A stock trading simulator which puts to test the player’s risk analysis and critical thinking capability.

Kryptos
In this online treasure hunt, players are pitted against one another, to prove their wit and wisdom in deciphering increasingly hard puzzles.

#include
A test of fundamental knowledge in C/C++, this event seeks out the greatest and most creative programmers to find efficient solutions to the stated problems.

Circuimstance
An event that requires its participants be knowledgeable in electronics, and its engineering. It is sure to push the participants to their limits.
